title: Start with Why
author: Simon Sinek
summary: Explores how leaders can inspire cooperation, trust, and change by starting with a clear sense of why.

title: Show Your Work!
author: Austin Kleon
summary: Encourages readers to share their creative processes and build an audience by being open and generous.

title: Steal Like an Artist
author: Austin Kleon
summary: Discusses how to embrace influence, remix ideas, and foster creativity by learning from others.

title: The Power of Habit
author: Charles Duhigg
summary: Examines the science behind why habits exist and how they can be changed.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
summary: Analyzes the dual systems of thought, fast and slow, that drive our decisions and behavior.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
summary: Traces the history of humanity from the Stone Age to the modern age.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
summary: A memoir about a woman who grows up in a strict and abusive household in rural Idaho but eventually escapes to learn about the wider world through education.

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson
summary: Advocates for embracing lifeâ€™s challenges and focusing on what truly matters.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
summary: Provides strategies for forming good habits, breaking bad ones, and mastering tiny behaviors that lead to remarkable results.

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
author: Stephen R. Covey
summary: Presents a principle-centered approach for solving personal and professional problems.

title: How to Win Friends and Influence People
author: Dale Carnegie
summary: Offers advice on how to improve interpersonal skills and influence others.

title: Quiet
author: Susan Cain
summary: Examines the value of introverts in a culture that celebrates extroversion.

title: The Lean Startup
author: Eric Ries
summary: Explains how startups can effectively manage and grow their business through continuous innovation.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
summary: A memoir by the former First Lady of the United States, Michelle Obama, detailing her life from childhood through her time in the White House.

title: The Four Agreements
author: Don Miguel Ruiz
summary: Reveals the source of self-limiting beliefs that rob us of joy and create needless suffering.

title: The Art of Seduction
author: Robert Greene
summary: Explores the techniques and strategies of seduction, examining historical and contemporary examples.
